Tyrael shrugs a bit, but not too much.

Tyrael: Unlike yours, my base is still flight capable. It transformed 
and landed. We Tripredacus actually consider this a better option than 
crashing and damaging anything. I will send it back in orbit so that 
it doesn't even get attacked. However, this will mean that me and my 
crew will be out of supplies unless Rodimus accepts to shelter us for 
the duration of the crisis. I can give the order and it would be in 
the air in no time. It would also provide us with orbital weaponry, 
mostly missiles.

He seems to regret having to leave his base, but he knows the 
situation requires it.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> ::Cygnar::
>        He receives a brief automated signal from his base.  He 
grimaces and 
> curses at himself for not having expected it.  "They have already 
moved 
> first.  My base is gone.  Destroyed by it's own self destruct.  I 
should've 
> seen that coming."  He shakes his head and looks at Tyrael.  "They 
will 
> attack you next.  The Maximal's are going to be their last target.  
I 
> recommend meeting them between your base and theirs.  Unless..."  He 
stares 
> intently at Tyrael.  "How attached are you to your base?"
